poem:
**Starlink in the Amazon**

In the whispering canopy, signals weave
as soldiers spill into the caiman's wake.
Their shadows breach the timeless green,
seeking the heart of a metal beast
sipping stars and churning gold,
while satellites hum in secret orbits,
their distant lights like ancient fires
guiding them to dreams and ruins
in the thick, untamed forever.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "‘Can’t live without it’: alarm at Musk’s Starlink dominance in Brazil’s Amazon The helicopter swooped into one of the most inaccessible corners of the Amazon rainforest. Brazilian special forces commandos leaped from its metal skids into the caiman-inhabited waters below. Their target, lurking in the woodland along Brazil’s Bóia River, was a hulking steel mining dredge, caught red-handed as it drilled into the riverbed, pulverising it in search of gold. Onboard, troops from the national". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
